string.name: STR_DIC_TEST04
string.body: Test;An ordeal that everyone and everything, even games, has to go through.

string.name: STR_DIC_ELA01
string.body: Sacred Water;Holy water found at [%dic:STR_DIC_FLA20]. Sediment gathers under the water when it's transferred into a bowl.

string.name: STR_DIC_ELA02
string.body: Aion;The Tower of Eternity. It was once the world's axis, and stretched across Atreia's interior. It has since been destroyed, and all that remains is the Tower of Light in Elysea and the Tower of Darkness in Asmodae.

string.name: STR_DIC_ELA03
string.body: Atreia;The name of the world before it was ripped apart by the Cataclysm. Though the term is still used in both Elyos and Asmodian society, the two halves of Atreia now have their own specific names: Asmodae and Elysea.

string.name: STR_DIC_ELA04
string.body: Aion;The being that both Elyos and Asmodians consider to be the creator of Atreia. Aion the creator and Aion the tower are believed to be one and the same.

string.name: STR_DIC_ELA05
string.body: Elysea;The lower half of Atreia. It was created as a result of the Cataclysm, and is now a land blessed with light and beauty. It is ruled by the Five Seraphim Lords.

string.name: STR_DIC_ELA06
string.body: Asmodae;The upper half of Atreia. It was created as a result of the Cataclysm, and is now a land shrouded in darkness. It is ruled by the Five Shedim Lords.

string.name: STR_DIC_ELA07
string.body: Sanctum;The capital city of Elysea that is floating in the air. It is also sometimes used to describe the Elyos government.

string.name: STR_DIC_ELA08
string.body: Pandaemonium;The sole city in Asmodae. The term is occasionally used to describe the Asmodian leadership.

string.name: STR_DIC_ELA09
string.body: Daeva;A winged being able to manipulate the power of Aether. Only very few Humans go through the process of ascension to become Daevas, and the requirements for being chosen are still not understood.

string.name: STR_DIC_ELA10
string.body: Guardians;The very strongest and most powerful of the Elyos Daevas.

string.name: STR_DIC_ELA11
string.body: Archons;The very strongest and most powerful of the Asmodian Daevas.

string.name: STR_DIC_ELA12
string.body: Empyrean Lords;The twelve beings created by Aion to protect Atreia against the Balaur terror. Two were destroyed in the Cataclysm, and the remaining ten became the five Seraphim Lords of Elysea, and the five Shedim Lords of Asmodae.

string.name: STR_DIC_ELA13
string.body: Aether;A fundamental energy used by Daevas to empower their spirits and maintain immortality. Aether is also the source of the Aetheric field. Following the destruction of the tower, Aetheric energy has continually bled from the both the Tower of Light and the Tower of Darkness, and if not stopped will result in Atreia's total destruction.

string.name: STR_DIC_ELA14
string.body: Abyss;A dimension created by the unstable flow of Aether following the fall of Aion. It's connected to Atreia through specific Rifts.

string.name: STR_DIC_ELA15
string.body: Nobelium;Temples constructed long ago in tribute of the Empyrean Lords. Priests work in the temples to serve as mediums between the Lords and Humans.

string.name: STR_DIC_ELA16
string.body: Obelisk;A device that resurrects defeated Daevas. Binding a Daeva's soul at a specific Obelisk allows the Daeva to resurrect there.

string.name: STR_DIC_ELA17
string.body: Cube;A magical device that stores items by reducing their size.

string.name: STR_DIC_ELA18
string.body: Sapien;A group of races that serve the Balaur. They are the Krall and Kobolds in Elysea, and the Mau and Skurvs in Asmodae. They are a constant distraction for both Elyos and Asmodian combat forces.

string.name: STR_DIC_ELA19
string.body: Odium;A stone imbued with Aether. Odium can be mined and has many uses.

string.name: STR_DIC_ELA20
string.body: Tribute to Elysea;Humans are often required to send tribute to their capital as a mark of respect to the Seraphim Lords. Tribute is most often given as livestock or crops.

string.name: STR_DIC_ELA21
string.body: Seraphim Festival;A festival dedicated to the Seraphim Lords. It is a huge event held regularly in Sanctum.

string.name: STR_DIC_ELA22
string.body: Temple of Ariel;A group of Guardians who serve [%dic:STR_DIC_LA56].

string.name: STR_DIC_ELA23
string.body: Temple of Justice;A group of Guardians who serve the Lord of Justice, [%dic:STR_DIC_LA57].

string.name: STR_DIC_ELA24
string.body: Lyceum;A holy ground within Sanctum. It is where the high priest and protectors serve the Five Seraphim Lords.

string.name: STR_DIC_ELA25
string.body: Temple of Illusion;A group of Guardians who serve the Lord of Illusion, [%dic:STR_DIC_LA59].

string.name: STR_DIC_ELA26
string.body: Temple of Freedom;A sacred sanctuary dedicated to the Lord of Freedom.

string.name: STR_DIC_ELA27
string.body: Mysterious Book of Magic;An ancient tome of arcane knowledge, prized by historians and scholars of magic.

string.name: STR_DIC_ELA28
string.body: Encyclopedia of the Wise;The most transcribed text in all of Atreia. This volume is an exhaustive collection of diverse knowledge, ranging from history to geography to just plain common sense.

string.name: STR_DIC_ELA29
string.body: Elim;Spirits of trees which can talk and move. They communicate with trees in the forest and are sensitive to any change in their natural environment.

string.name: STR_DIC_ELA31
string.body: Stigma Stone;A crystal containing the soul of a Daeva. New abilities can be learned by experiencing the defeated Daeva's memories.

string.name: STR_DIC_ELA59
string.body: Q5014 Tree;A tree that you can collect sap from.

string.name: STR_DIC_ELA60
string.body: Odella;A rare herb that grows by absorbing Aetheric energy.

string.name: STR_DIC_ELA61
string.body: Q5028;Delilah's pet D1

string.name: STR_DIC_ELA62
string.body: Q5060;A field object in the Spore forest which you must click with your reward item from the Q5059 quest.

string.name: STR_DIC_ELA63
string.body: Q5078;A field object Mirokin asks you to collect for his study.

string.name: STR_DIC_ELA64
string.body: Q5079;(an imaginary plant) A plant Hunmir needs for his studies.

string.name: STR_DIC_ELA65
string.body: Q5079b;(an imaginary plant 2) A plant Hunmir needs for his studies.

string.name: STR_DIC_ELA66
string.body: Q5083;What you must get by flying.

string.name: STR_DIC_ELA67
string.body: Q5088;A randomly-spawned collectable item. Crystal Stone

string.name: STR_DIC_ELA68
string.body: Q5088,5086;A transparent stone made of Crystal that is used in interpreting documents. Its name is undecided.

string.name: STR_DIC_ELA69
string.body: Q5091;A field object - a symbolic flag of Mau. Its name is undecided.

string.name: STR_DIC_ELA70
string.body: Illustrated Guide to Atreia Monsters;Quoted Q5053.

string.name: STR_DIC_ELA71
string.body: Fruit of Evil;An item which secretes poison and consumes the holder's HP. (Q5054)

string.name: STR_DIC_ELA72
string.body: Lamp of Aether;A magical lamp which glows in the presence of Aether. (Q5055)

string.name: STR_DIC_ELA73
string.body: Bone of Balaur;A bone of a cursed Balaur that has been uncovered by a storm. (Q5081)

string.name: STR_DIC_ELA74
string.body: Q5003_a;An iron bar

string.name: STR_DIC_ELA75
string.body: Q5003_b;Firewood

string.name: STR_DIC_ELA76
string.body: Angel of Death;The soul of Montlini, an Elyos Guardian who became a spirit after being massacred by the Shedim Lord Triniel on Ishalgen Island.

string.name: STR_DIC_ELA77
string.body: Laughing Mushroom;A mushroom which gives the eater a case of the giggles. (Q0514)

string.name: STR_DIC_ELA78
string.body: Bone Cemetery;A cemetery of animal bones, enchanted by magic and visible only to those who want to meet Skurv Shaman. (Q5018)

string.name: STR_DIC_ELA79
string.body: Introduction to Magic and Incantation;An aged tome on the fundamentals of magic and incantations. Unknown author. (Q5018)

string.name: STR_DIC_ELA80
string.body: Ice Quartz;An ice crystal that grows by consuming the Aetheric energy near the Fortress. (Q5033)

string.name: STR_DIC_ELA81
string.body: Cauldron;A huge cauldron that the Kobolds regularly use to boil all manner of strange substances.

string.name: STR_DIC_ELA82
string.body: Contaminated Swamp Plant;Seeds of a mutated plant growing in the [%dic:STR_DIC_FLA17].

string.name: STR_DIC_ELA83
string.body: Mysterious Stone;Mysterious stones empowered by Aether and floating in the sky above [%dic:STR_DIC_FLA19].

string.name: STR_DIC_E_12
string.body: Lepharist Revolutionaries;A hugely secretive organization. Members have been sighted throughout Atreia but no-one truly understands their purpose.

string.name: STR_DIC_E_14
string.body: Abyss Gate;A gate that forcefully connects two worlds together and allows travel between them. It is said that the distorted Aetheric power can open an Abyss Gate.

string.name: STR_DIC_E_18
string.body: Umkata's Three Tokens;They are [%dic:STR_DIC_I_QUEST_2018A], [%dic:STR_DIC_I_QUEST_2018B], and [%dic:STR_DIC_I_QUEST_2018C].

string.name: STR_DIC_W_DF1_22
string.body: Sprigg Den;Sprigg abodes scattered throughout the [%dic:STR_DIC_W_DF1_1] area.

string.name: STR_DIC_E_LF2_Fountain_Q1300_A
string.body: Laquepin Life Stone;A Life Stone found in the [%dic:STR_DIC_W_LF2_SZ_G2_SUB_1]. The Life Bead inside gives it divine power and enables it to produce clean water.

string.name: STR_DIC_E_LF2_Fountain_Q1300_B
string.body: Temple Life Stone;A Life Stone in the [%dic:STR_DIC_W_LF2_SZ_D_SUB_1]. The Life Bead inside gives it divine power and enables it to produce clean water.

string.name: STR_DIC_E_LF2_Fountain_Q1300_C
string.body: Desert Life Stone;A Life Stone in the [%dic:STR_DIC_W_LF2_SZ_C2], a barren, desert-like plain. It is located a short way to the east of the Golden Bough Legion garrison.

string.name: STR_DIC_E_LF2_Morpinos
string.body: Morphinos Pack;A pack of animals wandering the Eastern Eracus Desert. A Morphinos has dark green net patterns on its body and horns on the back of its head.

string.name: STR_DIC_E_LF2_Simurg
string.body: Gryphu Flock;A bird species abundant in the [%dic:STR_DIC_W_LF2_SZ_C2]. There is a nest of them to the south of the Scout Camp that has been causing trouble.

string.name: STR_DIC_E_LF2_1424_group1_1
string.body: Search Mission;A mission assigned to [%dic:STR_DIC_M_KrallScoutHK_38_An]s, [%dic:STR_DIC_M_KrallScoutLK_39_An]s, [%dic:STR_DIC_M_KrallScoutLK_40_An]es, [%dic:STR_DIC_M_AeC_KrallScoutHK_38_Ae]s, and [%dic:STR_DIC_M_AeC_KrallScoutHK_40_Ae]es. They spy on their enemy's movements.

string.name: STR_DIC_E_LF2_1424_group1_2
string.body: Raid Mission;A mission assigned to [%dic:STR_DIC_M_AeB_KrallScoutHK_38_Ae]s, [%dic:STR_DIC_M_AeB_KrallScoutHK_40_Ae]es, [%dic:STR_DIC_M_ReB_KrallScoutLK_39_Ae]s, [%dic:STR_DIC_M_ReB_KrallScoutLK_40_Ae]es, [%dic:STR_DIC_M_ReC_KrallScoutLK_38_Ae]s, and [%dic:STR_DIC_M_ReC_KrallScoutLK_40_Ae]es. They raid their enemy's supplies.

string.name: STR_DIC_E_LF2_1424_group2_1
string.body: Shamanic Mission;A mission assigned to [%dic:STR_DIC_M_KrallShamanHK_39_An]s, [%dic:STR_DIC_M_KrallShamanHK_38_Ae]s, [%dic:STR_DIC_M_WeB_KrallShamanHK_38_Ae]s, [%dic:STR_DIC_M_WeB_KrallShamanHK_40_Ae]s, [%dic:STR_DIC_M_WeC_KrallShamanHK_39_Ae]s, and [%dic:STR_DIC_M_WeC_KrallShamanHK_40_Ae]s. They attack their enemies with magic.

string.name: STR_DIC_E_LF2_1424_group2_2
string.body: Healing Mission;A mission assigned to [%dic:STR_DIC_M_KrallPriest_40_An]s, [%dic:STR_DIC_M_KrallPriestHK_38_Ae]s, [%dic:STR_DIC_M_KrallPriest_39_An]s, and [%dic:STR_DIC_M_PeB_KrallPriestHK_40_Ae]s. They heal the wounded with magic.

string.name: STR_DIC_E_LF2_1424_group3
string.body: Guarding Mission;A mission assigned to [%dic:STR_DIC_M_KeB_KrallKeeperHK_37_Ae]s, [%dic:STR_DIC_M_KeB_KrallKeeperHK_39_Ae]s, [%dic:STR_DIC_M_KeB_KrallKeeperHK_40_Ae]es, [%dic:STR_DIC_M_KeC_KrallKeeperHK_39_Ae]s, and [%dic:STR_DIC_M_KeC_KrallKeeperHK_40_Ae]s. They protect important facilities and high-ranking Krall.

string.name: STR_DIC_E_LF2_1035_fountain
string.body: Broken Mystic Spring;A mystic spring under the [%dic:STR_DIC_W_LF2_SZ_C2_SUB_1]. It is located at the border of the eastern and western parts of the Eracus desert.

string.name: STR_DIC_E_LF2_door
string.body: Abyss Gate;A mysterious gateway located deep in the [%dic:STR_DIC_W_LF2_SZ_K].

string.name: STR_DIC_E_LF2_Manduri_Q1307
string.body: Manduri;[%dic:STR_DIC_M_ManduriT_21_An]s, [%dic:STR_DIC_M_ManduriT_23_An]s, [%dic:STR_DIC_M_ManduriB_21_An]s, and [%dic:STR_DIC_M_ManduriB_23_An]s. They are found in the [%dic:STR_DIC_W_LF2_SZ_A1_SUB_1] and [%dic:STR_DIC_W_LF2_SZ_A1_SUB_2].

string.name: STR_DIC_E_LF3_Weapon_production
string.body: Weapon Forge;A forge in the [%dic:STR_DIC_W_DC1_5]. It maintains very hot temperatures to allow the smelting of metals.

string.name: STR_DIC_E_LF3_Mail_production
string.body: Armoursmithing Forge;A forge in the [%dic:STR_DIC_W_DC1_5]. It maintains a very hot temperature to allow the smelting metals.

string.name: STR_DIC_E_LF3_Cook_production
string.body: Oven;An oven in the [%dic:STR_DIC_W_DC1_5] where dishes are cooked, and food ingredients prepared.

string.name: STR_DIC_E_LF3_Work_production
string.body: Workbench;A table in the [%dic:STR_DIC_W_DC1_5] used to make handicrafting items.

string.name: STR_DIC_E_LF3_Alchemy_production
string.body: Alchemist's Table;A table in the [%dic:STR_DIC_W_DC1_5] which is needed when changing the structure of various materials.

string.name: STR_DIC_E_LF3_Weaving_production
string.body: Loom;Used to weave textiles and patch leathers in the [%dic:STR_DIC_W_DC1_5].

string.name: STR_DIC_N_Kirene
string.body: Kirenne;A ghost seen at the [%dic:STR_DIC_W_LF3_SZ_006] in Heiron. He still bears a grudge about the fact that no reinforcements were sent when his manor was under attack.

string.name: STR_DIC_E_LF3_SensoryArea_Q1062
string.body: Entrance of Indratu Barracks ;The entrance to the Indratu Barracks situated next to Kishar Village. There is a structure there that resembles the jawbone of a huge dragon.

string.name: STR_DIC_E_LF3_BackupFile_Q1057
string.body: Lepharist Research Data;Research data written by the Lepharists.

string.name: STR_DIC_N_Hippolyta
string.body: Hippolytus;A mysterious peddler who sometimes shows up at the [%dic:STR_DIC_W_LF2_SZ_E2_SUB_1]. No one knows who he is.

string.name: STR_DIC_E_LF3_Q1612
string.body: Research Paper;A research paper containing the results of important research done at the [%dic:STR_DIC_W_IDLF3LP_SZ_1]. It is contained in a wooden chest.

string.name: STR_DIC_E_Q1972
string.body: Anteros' Greatsword;A greatsword forged from Adamantium. Its design can be obtained from [%dic:STR_DIC_N_Nakia].

string.name: STR_DIC_E_Q1973
string.body: Fasimedes' Greatsword;A greatsword forged from Orichalcum. Its design can be obtained from [%dic:STR_DIC_N_Nakia].

string.name: STR_DIC_E_Q1977
string.body: Fasimedes' Necklace;A necklace made with 3 types of gems and mithril. Its design can be obtained from [%dic:STR_DIC_N_Shugo_c5].

string.body: Yummy Banquet;Refers to [%dic:STR_DIC_E_Q1978a], [%dic:STR_DIC_E_Q1978b], and [%dic:STR_DIC_E_Q1978c].

string.name: STR_DIC_E_Q1978a
string.body: Hestia's Tasty Salad;A vegetable dish favoured by Hestia. You can buy the Hestia's Salad recipe from [%dic:STR_DIC_N_Luelas], and if you're lucky you might cook up a tasty one.

string.name: STR_DIC_E_Q1978b
string.body: Hestia's Tasty Smoothie;A fruit dish favoured by Hestia. You can buy the Hestia's Smoothie recipe from [%dic:STR_DIC_N_Luelas], and if you're lucky you might cook up a tasty one.

string.name: STR_DIC_E_Q1978c
string.body: Hestia's Tasty Fish;A fish dish favoured by Hestia. You can buy the Hestia's Fish recipe from [%dic:STR_DIC_N_Luelas], and if you're lucky you might cook up a tasty one.

string.name: STR_DIC_E_Q1978d
string.body: Tasty Broiled Moonflower Fruit;The same recipe for Broiled Moonflower Fruit can produce different results. When cooked to perfection, it produces an especially delicious dish known as Tasty Broiled Moonflower Fruit.

string.body: Fine Banquet;Refers to [%dic:STR_DIC_E_Q1979a], [%dic:STR_DIC_E_Q1979b], [%dic:STR_DIC_E_Q1979c], and [%dic:STR_DIC_E_Q1979d].

string.name: STR_DIC_E_Q2981
string.body: Vidar's Spellbook;A spellbook made using Fine Stone of Wisdom and Magic Power Crystal. Its design can be obtained from [%dic:STR_DIC_N_Grad].

string.name: STR_DIC_E_Q2982
string.body: Zyakia's Sash;A sash fashioned from Sobi textile and platinum. Its design can be obtained from [%dic:STR_DIC_N_Kaiot].

string.name: STR_DIC_E_Q2983
string.body: Vidar's Sash;A sash fashioned from Linon textile and mithril. Its design can be obtained from [%dic:STR_DIC_N_Kaiot].

string.name: STR_DIC_E_DC1_Library
string.body: Library;The biggest library in Asmodae. It is known as the [%dic:STR_DIC_W_DC1_12].

string.name: STR_DIC_E_SensoryArea_Q1661A
string.body: Weapon Forge;A smithy behind a four-horned totem in the Kishar Village.

string.name: STR_DIC_E_SensoryArea_Q1661B
string.body: Odium Refinery;Found around a hill on the right after leaving the weapon forge.

string.name: STR_DIC_E_SensoryArea_Q1661C
string.body: Armour Forge;Located right behind the Odium Refinery.

string.name: STR_DIC_E_SensoryArea_Q1670A
string.body: Kerubar Island;A legendary floating island known to be hidden somewhere in Heiron. Rumour has it that Kerubar live on the island.

string.name: STR_DIC_E_SensoryArea_Q1670B
string.body: Jeshuchi Island;A legendary floating island known to be hidden somewhere in Heiron. Rumour has it that Jeshuchi lives on the island.

string.name: STR_DIC_E_SensoryArea_Q1670C
string.body: Zapiel Island;A legendary floating island known to be hidden somewhere in Heiron. Rumour has it that Zapiel lives on the island.

string.name: STR_DIC_E_Hidden_Bridge
string.body: Invisible Bridge;A legendary bridge known to link to another island. The bridge is not just invisible, it can only be crossed when you truly believe that the bridge exists.

string.name: STR_DIC_E_Q1647_maine
string.body: Myanee's Clothes;A Stenon blouse and a Stenon skirt often worn by Myanee. You can buy them from [%dic:STR_DIC_N_Arcinia] in Sanctum.

string.name: STR_DIC_E_Q1469_Zone
string.body: Fire Temple;A temple under the control of Kromede. You can get there through the entrance under [%dic:STR_DIC_W_LF2_SZ_D].

string.name: STR_DIC_E_Bellumus_Q2031
string.body: Belemu;A Sleeping Elder who is slowly turning into stone atop the Hill of Belemu.

string.name: STR_DIC_N_Tree_Nomove_Kasadlasil
string.body: Kasadrasil;An Elim who was put into sleep about 700 years ago when Ereshkigal's curse froze Kurngalfberg.

string.name: STR_DIC_E_AkanNamed_50_Al
string.body: Bollvig;An Elyos warrior who is rumoured to have achieved much in Asmodae. He now rules the Dark Domain of [%dic:STR_DIC_W_LF3_SZ_F3] in Heiron.

string.name: STR_DIC_N_Shugo_DF2_14
string.body: Ganimerk;A Shugo who was hired as an informer, but has not been heard from since he left for the [%dic:STR_DIC_W_DF2_SUB_E4].

string.name: STR_DIC_N_DF2_15
string.body: Chaomirk;A member of the Kidorun Grave Robber Band imprisoned in the [%dic:STR_DIC_W_DF2_SUB_E4].

string.name: STR_DIC_W_LF2_SZ_Dartas
string.body: Dartas Village;A small Human village to the south of [%dic:STR_DIC_W_LF2_SZ_C1_SUB_1].

string.name: STR_DIC_N_Girkapan
string.body: Girkapan;A Silver Mane Mau prisoner in Asmodae.

string.name: STR_DIC_N_Denlavis
string.body: Denlavis;A missing person. Hannet is anxiously looking for him.

string.name: STR_DIC_N_magic_circle
string.body: Magic Ward;A powerful circle of Aether, inscribed on the end of a cliff. It can be reached by climbing the slope to the right after leaving the [%dic:STR_DIC_W_AB1_15] Prison Camp.

string.name: STR_DIC_E_Valboa
string.body: Belbua;A lone farmer. Rumour has it that the Lepharists took him away to the [%dic:STR_DIC_W_LF3_SZ_003].

string.name: STR_DIC_E_Lgrade1
string.body: Rank 1 Elyos Soldier;An Elyos Daeva who has been recognised for distinguished service in the Abyss. There is no reward for defeating an Elyos whose character level is more than 10 levels below yours.

string.name: STR_DIC_E_Lgrade2
string.body: Rank 2 Elyos Soldier;An Elyos Daeva whose heroism in the Abyss is the pride of Sanctum. An Elyos Daeva who has been recognised for distinguished service in the Abyss. There is no reward for defeating an Elyos whose character level is more than 10 levels below yours.

string.name: STR_DIC_E_Lgrade3
string.body: Rank 3 Elyos Soldier;An Elyos Daeva who has gone above and beyond the call of duty in the Abyss. There is no reward for defeating an Elyos whose character level is more than 10 levels below yours.

string.name: STR_DIC_E_Lgrade4
string.body: Rank 4 Elyos Soldier;An Elyos Daeva recognised for a great many achievements in the Abyss. There is no reward for defeating an Elyos whose character level is more than 10 levels below yours.

string.name: STR_DIC_E_Lgrade5
string.body: Rank 5 Elyos Soldier;An Elyos Daeva who is a veteran of many battles in the Abyss. There is no reward for defeating an Elyos whose character level is more than 10 levels below yours.

string.name: STR_DIC_E_Lgrade6
string.body: Rank 6 Elyos Soldier;An Elyos Daeva who is climbing the ranks in the Abyss. There is no reward for defeating an Elyos whose character level is more than 10 levels below yours.

string.name: STR_DIC_E_Lgrade7
string.body: Rank 7 Elyos Soldier;An Elyos Daeva who is starting to be recognised for service in the Abyss. There is no reward for defeating an Elyos whose character level is more than 10 levels below yours.

string.name: STR_DIC_E_Lgrade8
string.body: Rank 8 Elyos Soldier;An Elyos Daeva who has begun making a mark in the Abyss. There is no reward for defeating an Elyos whose character level is more than 10 levels below yours.

string.name: STR_DIC_E_Lgrade9
string.body: Rank 9 Elyos Soldier;An Elyos Daeva who is just starting out in the Abyss. There is no reward for defeating an Elyos whose character level is more than 10 levels below yours.

string.name: STR_DIC_E_Lgrade00
string.body: Elyos Officer;An Elyos Daeva whose leadership skills have been recognised. There is no reward for defeating an Elyos whose character level is more than 10 levels below yours.

string.name: STR_DIC_E_Lgrade01
string.body: Elyos General;An Elyos Daeva whose strength and heroism have earned the trust of Sanctum. There is no reward for defeating an Elyos whose character level is more than 10 levels below yours.

string.name: STR_DIC_E_Dgrade1
string.body: Rank 1 Asmodian Soldier;An Asmodian Daeva who has been recognised for distinguished service in the Abyss. There is no reward for defeating an Asmodian whose character level is more than 10 levels below yours.

string.name: STR_DIC_E_Dgrade2
string.body: Rank 2 Asmodian Soldier;An Asmodian Daeva whose heroism in the Abyss is the pride of Pandaemonium. There is no reward for defeating an Asmodian whose character level is more than 10 levels below yours.

string.name: STR_DIC_E_Dgrade3
string.body: Rank 3 Asmodian Soldier;An Asmodian Daeva who has gone above and beyond the call of duty in the Abyss. There is no reward for defeating an Asmodian whose character level is more than 10 levels below yours.

string.name: STR_DIC_E_Dgrade4
string.body: Rank 4 Asmodian Soldier;An Asmodian Daeva recognised for a great many achievements in the Abyss. There is no reward for defeating an Asmodian whose character level is more than 10 levels below yours.

string.name: STR_DIC_E_Dgrade5
string.body: Rank 5 Asmodian Soldier;An Asmodian Daeva who is a veteran of many battles in the Abyss. There is no reward for defeating an Asmodian whose character level is more than 10 levels below yours.

string.name: STR_DIC_E_Dgrade6
string.body: Rank 6 Asmodian Soldier;An Asmodian Daeva who is climbing the ranks in the Abyss. There is no reward for defeating an Asmodian whose character level is more than 10 levels below yours.

string.name: STR_DIC_E_Dgrade7
string.body: Rank 7 Asmodian Soldier;An Asmodian Daeva is starting to be recognised for service in the Abyss. There is no reward for defeating an Asmodian whose character level is more than 10 levels below yours.

string.name: STR_DIC_E_Dgrade8
string.body: Rank 8 Asmodian Soldier;An Asmodian Daeva who has begun making a mark in the Abyss. There is no reward for defeating an Asmodian whose character level is more than 10 levels below yours.

string.name: STR_DIC_E_Dgrade9
string.body: Rank 9 Asmodian Soldier;An Asmodian Daeva just starting out in the Abyss. There is no reward for defeating an Asmodian whose character level is more than 10 levels below yours.

string.name: STR_DIC_E_Dgrade00
string.body: Asmodian Officer;An Asmodian Daeva whose leadership skills have been recognised. There is no reward for defeating an Asmodian whose character level is more than 10 levels below yours.

string.name: STR_DIC_E_Dgrade01
string.body: Asmodian General;An Asmodian Daeva whose strength and heroism have earned the trust of Pandaemonium. There is no reward for defeating an Asmodian whose character level is more than 10 levels below yours.

string.name: STR_DIC_E_Q1736
string.body: Fortress Gatekeeper;Gatekeepers guarding Siel's Western Fortress, Siel's Eastern Fortress and the Sulphur Fortress. They are classified into veteran, experienced, and novice. They only appear when the fortress is in a Vulnerable state.

string.name: STR_DIC_E_Q1738
string.body: Fortress Gatekeeper;Gatekeepers guarding Roah Fortress and the Krotan Refuge. They are classified into veteran, experienced, and novice. They only appear when the fortress is in a Vulnerable state.

string.name: STR_DIC_E_Q2736
string.body: Fortress Gatekeeper;Gatekeepers guarding Siel's Western Fortress, Siel's Eastern Fortress and the Sulphur Fortress. They are classified into veteran, experienced, and novice. They only appear when the fortress is in a Vulnerable state.

string.name: STR_DIC_E_Q2738
string.body: Fortress Gatekeeper;Gatekeepers guarding Roah Fortress and the Krotan Refuge. They are classified into veteran, experienced, and novice. They only appear when the fortress is in a Vulnerable state.

string.name: STR_DIC_E_MammothKing_Q2620
string.body: Gigantic Phagrasul;The spirit of Phagrasul that you can summon by drumming on a [%dic:STR_DIC_OBJ_DF3_FOBJ_Q2620] and playing a horn.

string.name: STR_DIC_E_QUEST_2033b
string.body: Cursed Necklace;It is said that anyone who owns this necklace will gain a great fortune. However, it is imbued with a terrible curse that makes its owner lose all their loved ones, and forces them to live alone for the rest of their life.

string.name: STR_DIC_E_LF1_name
string.body: Poeta;A peaceful region centered around Akarios village.

string.name: STR_DIC_E_LF1A_name
string.body: Verteron;A wet and cold region centered around the fortress village where the Abyss Path was discovered.

string.name: STR_DIC_E_LF2_name
string.body: Eltnen;Eltnen means "the beautiful land". It was the most stunning region in all of Atreia until the Millennium War, but since then has stuggled with a continuing and irresistable desertification that threatens the entire region.

string.name: STR_DIC_E_LF3_name
string.body: Heiron;A region in Elysea that has been invaded by the Balaur through instability of the Aetheric Field.

string.name: STR_DIC_E_DF1_name
string.body: Ishalgen;A small but diverse region in Asmodae. The village there, Ishalgen village, is currently inhabited by raiders.

string.name: STR_DIC_E_DF1A_name
string.body: Altgard;A cold region centered around the fortress village where an Abyss path was discovered. It is so cold that the area surrounding the fortress is permanently frozen.

string.name: STR_DIC_E_DF2_name
string.body: Morheim;Morheim means 'the land of death', and the region is the most rugged area in all of Atreia.

string.name: STR_DIC_E_DF3_name
string.body: Beluslan;A barren region barely capable of sustaining Humans life. It has vast lifeless plains and high mountains.

string.name: STR_DIC_W_ZONE_NAME_LF2A
string.body: Theobomos;A region burnt to ashes during the Cataclysm. Only recently have treasure-hunting Shugos and runaway criminals gathered there to form a ragtag village.

string.name: STR_DIC_W_ZONE_NAME_DF2A
string.body: Brusthonin;It was once the breadbasket of Asmodae but has turned into a wasteland swarmed with the Undead. A reclamation project to revive the land is now in progress.

string.name: STR_DIC_W_ZONE_Path_LF2A
string.body: Theobomos;Onesimus, Eltnen's teleporter and Polyidus, Sanctum's teleporter can both send you there.

string.name: STR_DIC_W_IDLF3LP_SZ_1
string.body: Aetherogenetics Lab;A research lab inside the Lepharist Research Centre in Heiron. Its entrance is guarded by [%dic:STR_DIC_M_ID_Kuillus_41_Ae].

string.name: STR_DIC_W_NAME_IDLF2A_Lab
string.body: Theobomos Lab;A hidden area that can be entered via the [%dic:STR_DIC_OBJ_LF2a_Door_Q1094].

string.name: STR_DIC_W_NAME_IDDF2A_Adma
string.body: Adma Stronghold;A hidden area that can be entered via the [%dic:STR_DIC_OBJ_DF2a_AdmaDoor_In].

string.name: STR_DIC_E_DF2B_Q2094
string.body: Suspicious Person;A suspicious individual who has recently been spotted at the Adma Stronghold. According to reports he looks like a young boy.

string.name: STR_DIC_N_pippi
string.body: Pippi;Morati's pet Porgus. Pippi disappeared when Morati went to pick mushrooms in the [%dic:STR_DIC_W_LF2B_SZ_C6], and was last spotted in the [%dic:STR_DIC_W_LF2B_SZ_C5].

string.name: STR_DIC_E_LF2B_Q1094
string.body: Assistant's Journal;A journal discovered in the Theobomos Library which details a report on Petraliths. Click the journal to read it.

string.name: STR_DIC_W_IDAbRe_Low_Divine_SZ_All
string.body: Sulphur Tree Nest;A hidden chamber that can only be reached from within the Sulphur Fortress.

string.name: STR_DIC_W_IDAbRe_Low_Eciel_SZ_All
string.body: Right Wing Chamber;A hidden chamber that can only be reached from within Siel's Eastern Fortress.

string.name: STR_DIC_W_IDAbRe_Low_Wciel_SZ_All
string.body: Left Wing Chamber;A hidden chamber that can only be reached from within Siel's Western Fortress.

string.name: STR_DIC_W_IDAbRe_Up_Asteria_SZ_All
string.body: Hurricane Isle Treasure Chamber;A hidden treasure chamber which can be reached from the Stormy Isles.

string.name: STR_DIC_W_IDAbRe_Up_Rhoo_SZ_All
string.body: Zephyr Isle Treasure Chamber;A hidden treasure chamber which can be reached from the Stormy Isles.

string.name: STR_DIC_W_IDAbRe_Up3_Crotan_SZ_All
string.body: Isle of Roots Treasure Chamber;A hidden treasure chamber which can be reached from the Stormy Isles.

string.name: STR_DIC_W_IDAbRe_Up3_LaMiren_SZ_All
string.body: Twilight Battlefield Treasure Chamber;A hidden treasure chamber which can be reached from the Stormy Isles.

string.name: STR_DIC_W_IDAbRe_Up3_Dkisas_SZ_All
string.body: Grave of Steel Treasure Chamber;A hidden treasure chamber which can be reached from the Stormy Isles.

string.name: STR_DIC_W_IDLF3_Castle_Indratoo
string.body: Indratu Fortress;A fortress where the Indratu Legion is garrisoned.

string.name: STR_DIC_E_RESURRECT
string.body: Resurrection Skill;A skill that resurrects defeated allies. Only Clerics and Chanters can use it.

string.name: STR_DIC_E_DP_Fi
string.body: Daevic Fury I;A Gladiator skill which requires the consumption of DP.

string.name: STR_DIC_E_DP_Kn
string.body: Hand of Healing I;A Templar skill which requires the consumption of DP.

string.name: STR_DIC_E_DP_Ra
string.body: Destruction Trap I;A Ranger skill which requires the consumption of DP.

string.name: STR_DIC_E_DP_As
string.body: Wind Walk I;An Assassin skill which requires the consumption of DP.

string.name: STR_DIC_E_DP_Wi
string.body: Tranquilizing Cloud I;A Sorcerer skill which requires the consumption of DP.

string.name: STR_DIC_E_DP_El
string.body: Disenchant I;A Spiritmaster skill which requires the consumption of DP.

string.name: STR_DIC_E_DP_Pr
string.body: Acquittal I;A Cleric skill which requires the consumption of DP.

string.name: STR_DIC_E_DP_Ch
string.body: Word of Wind I;A Chanter skill which requires the consumption of DP.

string.name: STR_DIC_N_Pacerta
string.body: Arbolu;A holy tree in Arbolu's Haven. It communicates through [%dic:STR_DIC_N_Tree_Pacerta].

string.name: STR_DIC_W_ZONE_NAME_IDElim
string.body: Taloc's Hollow;An abnormal space inside the Holy Tree Taloc.

string.name: STR_DIC_W_ZONE_NAME_LF4
string.body: Inggison;A part of Tiamat's territory in Balaurea. It connects to Gelkmaros via the Silentera Canyon.

string.name: STR_DIC_W_ZONE_NAME_DF4
string.body: Gelkmaros;A part of Tiamat's territory in Balaurea. It connects to Inggison via the Silentera Canyon.

string.name: STR_DIC_FLA27
string.body: Sanctum;The glorious capital city of Elysea, floating high above the ground through the power of the Seraphim Lords.

string.name: STR_DIC_W_LC2
string.body: Cloister of Kaisinel;A temple located deep inside Sanctum. It is said that Kaisinel himself often visits there. You can reach the temple through [%dic:STR_DIC_OBJ_LC1_LC2_TELEPORT] in the Exalted Path.

string.name: STR_DIC_W_IDLF1
string.body: Dark Poeta;A possible future for Poeta where it has been captured by the Balaur.

string.name: STR_DIC_W_DC2
string.body: Convent of Marchutan;A temple located deep inside Pandaemonium. It is said that Marchutan himself often visits there. You can reach the temple through [%dic:STR_DIC_OBJ_DC1_DC2_TELEPORT].

string.name: STR_DIC_W_caspa_light
string.body: Taloc's Hollow;An abnormal space inside the Holy Tree Taloc. You may enter by asking [%dic:STR_DIC_N_Elim_DF4_01].

string.name: STR_DIC_W_caspa_dark
string.body: Taloc's Hollow;An abnormal space inside the Holy Tree Taloc. You may enter by asking [%dic:STR_DIC_N_CaspaGhost_02].

string.name: STR_DIC_M_Q1019add
string.body: Krall Head Priest;[%dic:STR_DIC_MLA128] and [%dic:STR_DIC_M_LF1A_TKrallShamanNmd_19_An] are both important figured among the Krall. Disrupt the balance of power between the Krall and Kobolds by disposing of either.

string.name: STR_DIC_W_IDAbRe_Core_SZ_All
string.body: Abyssal Splinter;A small Abyss which can be entered from the Divine Fortress. It is rich with Aether energy.

string.name: STR_DIC_E_IDRaksha_SensoryArea_01
string.body: Vasuki's Whereabouts;After meeting with The Flamelord, Vasuki departed for the bottom of Raksang.

string.name: STR_DIC_E_DP_Ra2
string.body: Transformation: Mau;A Hunter skill which requires the consumption of DP.

string.name: STR_DIC_MLA137
string.body: Dukaki;A tribe of Kobolds working in the [%dic:STR_DIC_FLA07]. They include [%dic:STR_DIC_MLA13_1]s, [%dic:STR_DIC_MLA13_2]s, [%dic:STR_DIC_MLA13_3]s, and [%dic:STR_DIC_MLA13_4]s.

string.name: STR_DIC_N_LF3_Ghost_Litonos
string.body: Litonos;[%dic:STR_DIC_N_Berone]'s lover. He's sometimes seen near the [%dic:STR_DIC_W_LF3_SZ_D6] in Heiron.

string.name: STR_DIC_W_DF1A_spot
string.body: Fresh Water Source;A pond where the fresh water of the waterfall in the [%dic:STR_DIC_W_DF1A_13] gathers.

string.name: STR_DIC_QUEST_2122a
string.body: Victim Bones;The remains of those murdered long ago by the escaped prisoners of the [%dic:STR_DIC_W_DF1_7].

string.name: STR_DIC_N_LycanSurvivor_Q2059
string.body: Hoarfrost Survivor;The injured who survived the battle between the Balaur and the Hoarfrost Tribe.

string.name: STR_DIC_M_lasberg_monster
string.body: Bollvig;A fallen Asmodian Archon in Elysea. He is remarkably powerful and has taken some of the most dreadful weapons known. He can be found on the floating island at the centre of The Storm Circle.

string.name: STR_DIC_N_Seirenia_Q
string.body: Seirenia;A mysterious beauty who enjoys bathing in [%dic:STR_DIC_FLA04_1] in the [%dic:STR_DIC_FLA04] every night. Nobody knows what she does or where she goes during the day.

string.name: STR_DIC_N_Seirenia_city
string.body: Seirenia;A scholar who studies the lands of Asmodae. She can be in the [%dic:STR_DIC_FLA38].

string.name: STR_DIC_N_Shugo_zyaorung
string.body: Jaiorunerk;A legendary cube craftsman who is said to know the secret of crafting the 100-slot cube. Factional disputes drove him into hiding at the Orton Farm in Heiron, but he has been missing since the Krall took over the area. Now only a number of Porgus he used to raise remain at the site.

string.name: STR_DIC_M_ManduriT_all
string.body: Manduri;Refers to creatures such as the [%dic:STR_DIC_M_ManduriT_21_An]s, [%dic:STR_DIC_M_ManduriB_21_An]s, [%dic:STR_DIC_M_ManduriT_23_An]s, and [%dic:STR_DIC_M_ManduriB_23_An]s.

string.name: STR_DIC_M_Harpy_all
string.body: Virago;[%dic:STR_DIC_M_Harpy_32_An]s and [%dic:STR_DIC_M_Harpy_33_An]s in the Kuriullu Mountain. They are very territorial and will attack anyone who comes near.

string.name: STR_DIC_M_Pretor_31_all
string.body: Pretor;It is also known as a [%dic:STR_DIC_M_Pretor_31_An], and can be found on [%dic:STR_DIC_W_LF2_SZ_I1].

string.name: STR_DIC_M_elementalair3_33_all
string.body: Wind Spirit;[%dic:STR_DIC_M_elementalair3_33_An]s and [%dic:STR_DIC_M_elementalair3_32_An]s that live on the [%dic:STR_DIC_W_LF2_SZ_I1].

string.name: STR_DIC_M_all_KrallWarrior
string.body: Kaidan Combat Force;Indicates Kaidan Krall soldiers that have been deployed to battles, including [%dic:STR_DIC_M_KrallWarriorHK_37_Ae]s, [%dic:STR_DIC_M_FeB_KrallWarriorHK_37_Ae]s, [%dic:STR_DIC_M_FeB_KrallWarriorHK_39_Ae]s, [%dic:STR_DIC_M_FeC_KrallWarriorHK_38_Ae]s, [%dic:STR_DIC_M_FeC_KrallWarriorHK_40_Ae]s, etc.

string.name: STR_DIC_M_KrallWarriorMMad_all
string.body: Fanatic Krall;Indicates [%dic:STR_DIC_M_KrallWarriorMMad_40_An]s, [%dic:STR_DIC_M_KrallFighterMad_42_Ae]s, [%dic:STR_DIC_M_KrallScoutHMad_40_An]s, [%dic:STR_DIC_M_KrallAssassinMad_42_Ae]s, [%dic:STR_DIC_M_KrallRangerMad_40_Ae]s, [%dic:STR_DIC_M_KrallRangerMad_42_Ae]s, [%dic:STR_DIC_M_KrallWizardMad_40_Ae]s, and [%dic:STR_DIC_M_KrallWizardMad_42_Ae]s.

string.name: STR_DIC_M_LizardmanFighter_all
string.body: Indratu Legionary;Indicates [%dic:STR_DIC_M_LizardmanFighter_44_An]s, [%dic:STR_DIC_M_LizardmanRanger_44_An]s, [%dic:STR_DIC_M_LizardmanPriest_44_An]s, [%dic:STR_DIC_M_LizardmanAssassin_44_An]s, and [%dic:STR_DIC_M_LizardmanAssassin_45_An]s.

string.name: STR_DIC_M_UNdeadLight_all
string.body: Ancient Guardian Spirit;[%dic:STR_DIC_M_UNdeadLightFiD_26_An]s, [%dic:STR_DIC_M_UNdeadLightHighFiD_26_An]s, and [%dic:STR_DIC_M_UNdeadLightWiD_26_An]s found in the [%dic:STR_DIC_W_DF2_SUB_B1_3].

string.name: STR_DIC_M_ElementalEarth4D_all
string.body: Earth Spirit;Includes the [%dic:STR_DIC_M_ElementalEarth2D_35_An]s, [%dic:STR_DIC_M_ElementalEarth3D_35_An]s, and [%dic:STR_DIC_M_ElementalEarth4D_36_An]s that guard [%dic:STR_DIC_W_DF2_SUB_E1].

string.name: STR_DIC_M_ElementalWater4D_all
string.body: Water Spirit;Includes the [%dic:STR_DIC_M_ElementalWater2D_35_An]s, [%dic:STR_DIC_M_ElementalWater3D_36_An]s, and [%dic:STR_DIC_M_ElementalWater4D_37_An]s that guard [%dic:STR_DIC_W_DF2_SUB_E1].

string.name: STR_DIC_M_Ettin_all
string.body: Ettin;Creatures found near the [%dic:STR_DIC_W_DF2_SUB_A1]. Specifically, [%dic:STR_DIC_M_EttinD_21_An]s and [%dic:STR_DIC_M_EttinBigD_22_An]s.

string.name: STR_DIC_E_AB1_name
string.body: Tigraki Island;An island occupied by the legendary Tigraki Workshop, which is famed for crafting Balic items. Its exact location is unknown.

string.name: STR_DIC_W_AB1_59
string.body: Black Cloud Island;An island located far to the south of the Bloodburn Reach. It is the main base of the Black Cloud Merchants.

They include [%dic:STR_DIC_M_IDLF1_D_NagaFi_50_Ae], [%dic:STR_DIC_M_IDLF1_D_NagaMage_50_Ae], [%dic:STR_DIC_M_IDLF1_NagaPriest_50_Ae], and [%dic:STR_DIC_M_IDLF1_B_NagaElementalist_50_Ah].

string.name: STR_DIC_M_IDLF1_Dragel_Brownie
string.body: Brainwashed Dukaki Tribe;The Dukaki who were injected with Dragel and brainwashed by the Balaur. You can get [%dic:STR_DIC_I_quest_3915a]s by killing [%dic:STR_DIC_M_IDLF1_F_DBrownieMScCra_50_Ae]s, [%dic:STR_DIC_M_IDLF1_F_MBrownieFWaCra_50_Ae]s, [%dic:STR_DIC_M_IDLF1_H_DBrownieMScCra_50_Ae]s and [%dic:STR_DIC_M_IDLF1_H_MBrownieFWaCra_50_Ae]s.

string.name: STR_DIC_M_IDLF1_Generator1
string.body: Power Generator;A device that supplies power to the Abyss Gate. It is comprised of an [%dic:STR_DIC_M_IDLF1_Generator1_50_Ah], an [%dic:STR_DIC_M_IDLF1_Generator2_50_Ah], and [%dic:STR_DIC_M_IDLF1_Generator3_50_Ah].

string.name: STR_DIC_M_IDLF1_Surkana_Drakan
string.body: Surkana Supervisor;Drakan supervising the supply of Surkana. They include [%dic:STR_DIC_M_IDLF1_E_DrakanFighter_50_Ae], [%dic:STR_DIC_M_IDLF1_E_DrakanAssassin_50_Ae], [%dic:STR_DIC_M_IDLF1_E_DrakanWizard_50_Ae], [%dic:STR_DIC_M_IDLF1_E_DrakanPriest_50_Ae], [%dic:STR_DIC_M_IDLF1_F_DrakanFighter_50_Ae]es, [%dic:STR_DIC_M_IDLF1_F_DrakanAssassin_50_Ae]s, [%dic:STR_DIC_M_IDLF1_F_DrakanPriest_50_Ae]s, [%dic:STR_DIC_M_IDLF1_F_DrakanWizard_50_Ae]s, [%dic:STR_DIC_M_IDLF1_G_DrakanFighter_50_Ae]s, [%dic:STR_DIC_M_IDLF1_G_DrakanAssassin_50_Ae]s, [%dic:STR_DIC_M_IDLF1_G_DrakanWizard_50_Ae]s, [%dic:STR_DIC_M_IDLF1_G_DrakanPriest_50_Ae]s, [%dic:STR_DIC_M_IDLF1_H_DrakanFighter_50_Ae]s, [%dic:STR_DIC_M_IDLF1_H_DrakanAssassin_50_Ae]s, [%dic:STR_DIC_M_IDLF1_H_DrakanWizard_50_Ae]s, and [%dic:STR_DIC_M_IDLF1_H_DrakanPriest_50_Ae]s.

string.name: STR_DIC_M_IDLF1_WaterGolem1
string.body: Marabata;A magical creature of the Anuhart Legion, created by submerging a Drazma Core in lake water. There are the [%dic:STR_DIC_M_IDLF1_NM_WaterGolem1_50_Ah], the [%dic:STR_DIC_M_IDLF1_NM_WaterGolem2_50_Ah], and the [%dic:STR_DIC_M_IDLF1_NM_WaterGolem3_50_Ah] types.

string.name: STR_DIC_M_IDAb1_Dreadgion_Elite
string.body: Elite Soldiers of the Baranath Legion;The core force of the Baranath Legion. They include [%dic:STR_DIC_M_IDAb1_Dreadgion_LizardFi_50_Ae]s, [%dic:STR_DIC_M_IDAb1_Dreadgion_LizardAs_50_Ae]s, [%dic:STR_DIC_M_IDAb1_Dreadgion_NagaFi_50_Ae]s, [%dic:STR_DIC_M_IDAb1_Dreadgion_NagaPr_50_Ae]s, [%dic:STR_DIC_M_IDAb1_Dreadgion_DrakanFiHigh_50_Ae], [%dic:STR_DIC_M_IDAb1_Dreadgion_DrakanScHigh_50_Ae], [%dic:STR_DIC_M_IDAb1_Dreadgion_DrakanMaHigh_50_Ae], and [%dic:STR_DIC_M_IDAb1_Dreadgion_DrakanClHigh_50_Ae].

string.name: STR_DIC_E_Dreadgion_Prison_Door
string.body: Prison Cell;Cells in the No.1 and No.2 Dredgion Prisoner Brigs. [%dic:STR_DIC_M_IDAb1_Dreadgion_DrakanRaKeyNamedA_50_Ae] and [%dic:STR_DIC_M_IDAb1__Dreadgion_DrakanRaKeyNamedB_50_Ae] carry the keys. Ordinary soldiers of the Baranath Legion may also carry the keys, albeit very rarely.

string.name: STR_DIC_E_Q3937
string.body: Malicemark;Refers to a [%dic:STR_DIC_I_quest_3937a] that you can get by defeating [%dic:STR_DIC_M_IDLF1_H_DrakanFiName_50_Ah] and [%dic:STR_DIC_M_IDLF2A_ElementalKingNmd_50_Ah].

string.name: STR_DIC_M_STR_IDLF1_F_Spaller
string.body: Drana Spaller Insect;Insect-shaped devices used to collect the Drana at The Drana Fields. There are [%dic:STR_DIC_M_IDLF1_F_Spaller_50_Ah]s, [%dic:STR_DIC_M_STR_IDLF1_F_Spaller2_50_Ah]s, and [%dic:STR_DIC_M_STR_IDLF1_F_Spaller3_50_Ah]s.

string.name: STR_DIC_E_Q4941
string.body: Deathmark;Refers to [%dic:STR_DIC_I_quest_4941a] that you can get by defeating [%dic:STR_DIC_M_IDLF1_H_DrakanFiName_50_Ah] and [%dic:STR_DIC_M_Adma_DeathknightNamed_50_Ah].

string.name: STR_DIC_E_Q3936
string.body: Theobomos Deathmark;Refers to the Bloodwing's Wings, Sylphen Saliva, Hornskull's Tongue, and Abex Horn you obtained from hunting [%dic:STR_DIC_M_LF2A_BATyellow_49_An], [%dic:STR_DIC_M_LF2A_MutaHook_48_An], [%dic:STR_DIC_M_LF2A_SalivadoRed_47_An], [%dic:STR_DIC_M_LF2A_SalivadoRed_49_An], and [%dic:STR_DIC_M_LF2A_Fethlot_48_n].

string.name: STR_DIC_E_Q4940
string.body: Deathmark in Brusthonin;Refers to the Crown Ksellid's Sting, Rocky Back Ksellid's Shell, Refugee's Old Clothes, and Lobnite's Stalk you obtained from hunting [%dic:STR_DIC_M_DF2A_ShellizardStoneD_48_n]s, [%dic:STR_DIC_M_DF2A_ShellizardDesertD_48_n]s, [%dic:STR_DIC_M_DF2A_ZombieMiddleageFD_49_An]s, and [%dic:STR_DIC_M_DF2A_LobniteWaterPlantD_47_n]s.

string.name: STR_DIC_N_IDAB1_Dreadgion_prisoner_light
string.body: Elyos Prisoner;Prisoners caught while investigating the Dredgion. There are both [%dic:STR_DIC_N_IDAB1_Dreadgion_prisoner_light1]s and [%dic:STR_DIC_N_IDAB1_Dreadgion_prisoner_light2]s aboard.

string.name: STR_DIC_N_IDAB1_Dreadgion_prisoner_dark
string.body: Captured Asmodian Prisoner;Prisoners held captive while investigating the Dredgion. There are both [%dic:STR_DIC_N_IDAB1_Dreadgion_prisoner_dark1]s and [%dic:STR_DIC_N_IDAB1_Dreadgion_prisoner_dark2]s aboard.

string.name: STR_DIC_E_Low_Wciel
string.body: Left Wing Chamber Balaur;Refers to all the Balaur defending the [%dic:STR_DIC_W_IDAbRe_Low_Wciel_SZ_All].

string.name: STR_DIC_E_Up3_Crotan
string.body: Treasure Chamber Balaur on the Isle of Roots;Refers to all Balaur in the [%dic:STR_DIC_W_IDAbRe_Up3_Crotan_SZ_All].

string.name: STR_DIC_E_Up3_Dkisas
string.body: Treasure Chamber Balaur in the Grave of Steel;Refers to all Balaur in the [%dic:STR_DIC_W_IDAbRe_Up3_Dkisas_SZ_All].

string.name: STR_DIC_E_Up3_LaMiren
string.body: Treasure Chamber Balaur on the Twilight Battlefield;Refers to all Balaur in the [%dic:STR_DIC_W_IDAbRe_Up3_LaMiren_SZ_All].

string.name: STR_DIC_E_Q3932all
string.body: Objects for stopping the Stigma use;Refers to the [%dic:STR_DIC_I_QUEST_3932a] and [%dic:STR_DIC_I_QUEST_3932b], both of which can be obtained in Dark Poeta.

string.name: STR_DIC_E_Q4936all
string.body: Clues of the Artificial Stigma;Refers to the [%dic:STR_DIC_I_Q4936a]s and [%dic:STR_DIC_I_Q4936b], both of which can be obtained in Dark Poeta.

string.name: STR_DIC_E_Q2099all
string.body: Guardian Legionary;Refers to [%dic:STR_DIC_M_AbProD3_Guardian_Fighter]s, [%dic:STR_DIC_M_AbProD3_Guardian_Assassin]s, [%dic:STR_DIC_M_AbProD3_Guardian_Ranger]s, and [%dic:STR_DIC_M_AbProD3_Guardian_Healer]s in Ataxiar.

string.name: STR_DIC_E_Q1099all
string.body: Orissan Legionary;Refers to [%dic:STR_DIC_M_IDAbProL3_LizardFi_50_An]s, [%dic:STR_DIC_M_IDAbProL3_LizardAs_50_An]s, [%dic:STR_DIC_M_IDAbProL3_LizardRa_50_An]s, and [%dic:STR_DIC_M_IDAbProL3_LizardPr_50_An]s in Karamatis.

string.name: STR_DIC_E_Q4907E
string.body: Test Subjects of the Elyos Lepharists;Refers to the test subjects of the Lepharist Revolutionaries, such as [%dic:STR_DIC_M_RM78], [%dic:STR_DIC_M_IDLF3CL_LehparTestResultM_44_Ae], and [%dic:STR_DIC_M_ID4R_HumanTestNM_45_Ah].

string.name: STR_DIC_M_IDLF3CL_LehparTestResultM_44_Ae
string.body: RM-138c;A test subject of the Lepharist Revolutionaries. It can be found in the [%dic:STR_DIC_W_LF3_Lehpar].

string.name: STR_DIC_M_ID4R_HumanTestNM_45_Ah
string.body: RM-108c;A test subject of the Lepharist Revolutionaries. It can be found in the [%dic:STR_DIC_W_IDLF3LP_SZ_1].

string.name: STR_DIC_W_LF3_Lehpar
string.body: Azoturan Fortress;A base built by the Lepharist Revolutionaries in the Abyss. Rumours suggest there's a passage leading to it somewhere within the Lepharist Research Centre in Heiron.

string.name: STR_DIC_W_IDAb1_MiniCastle_SZ
string.body: Nochsana Training Camp;A Balaur training camp in the Abyss, accessible through the [%dic:STR_DIC_OBJ_AB1_Corridor_Q3702].

string.name: STR_DIC_N_Shugo_Shulack_01
string.body: Haorunerk;An aging Shugo of the Black Cloud Merchants. He disappeared right before his retirement, after boarding a merchant ship.

string.name: STR_DIC_M_IDAbProL3_NagaNamed_50_An
string.body: Orissan;The head of the Balaur in Karamatis. It is capable of hiding a person's memories away.

string.name: STR_DIC_M_AbProD3_Guardian_Boss
string.body: Brigade General Hellion;An Elyos Brigade General. He is so powerful that there is even a rumour of him being the 13th Empyrean Lord.

string.name: STR_DIC_E_Poeta_Li
string.body: Dark Poeta;A future Poeta, one that burns after being conquered by the Balaur. You can reach it through the Artefact of Transcendence if you have a [%dic:STR_DIC_I_3705_Li].

string.name: STR_DIC_E_Poeta_Da
string.body: Dark Poeta;A glimpse into the future, of an Elyos region now ruled by the Balaur. You can reach it through the Artefact of Circulation if you have a [%dic:STR_DIC_I_4705_Da].

string.name: STR_DIC_E_Ship_Li
string.body: Steel Rake;The ship of the Shulack Pirates. It is anchored near the Floating Island between Elysea and Asmodae. [%dic:STR_DIC_N_LF3_ShulackShip_Entrance] can take you aboard.

string.name: STR_DIC_E_Ship_Da
string.body: Steel Rake;The ship of the Shulack Pirates. It is anchored near the Floating Island between Elysea and Asmodae. [%dic:STR_DIC_N_DF3_ShulackShip_Entrance] can take you aboard.

string.name: STR_DIC_E_Vivre
string.body: Fangwings of the Eracus Temple Cavern;Refers to the [%dic:STR_DIC_M_0C_Vivre_28_An]s, [%dic:STR_DIC_M_1C_Vivre_28_Ae]s, [%dic:STR_DIC_M_2C_Vivre_29_Ae]s, [%dic:STR_DIC_M_2C_VivrePath_29_Ae]s and [%dic:STR_DIC_M_7C_Vivre_31_Ae]s inhabiting the Eracus Temple Cavern.

string.name: STR_DIC_E_Q4311
string.body: Lost Necklace Parts;Refers to the Snow Crystal Pendant, Ice Bead, Frost Bead and Platinum Clasp that Embla lost. These are thought to be swallowed by [%dic:STR_DIC_M_DrakeAgDGuard_30_Ae], [%dic:STR_DIC_M_ShadowstalkerreWiGuard_30_Ae], [%dic:STR_DIC_M_SouledstoneDReGuard_31_Ae], and [%dic:STR_DIC_M_ElementalFire3D_31_An].

string.name: STR_DIC_E_Q1692
string.body: Platinum Ore;Best gathered near the New Heiron Gate.

string.name: STR_DIC_E_IDTemple_LF4
string.body: Udas Temple;An old Beritra Temple occupied by the Balaur and the Dragonbound. You can reach it by passing through the [%dic:STR_DIC_W_LF4_SZ_B6].

string.name: STR_DIC_E_IDTemple_DF4
string.body: Udas Temple;An old Beritra Temple occupied by the Balaur and the Dragonbound. You can reach it by passing through the [%dic:STR_DIC_W_SZ_DF4_B6].

string.name: STR_DIC_E_IDTemple_SensoryArea_Q30003
string.body: Dragonbound Secret;The reason the Dragonbound are occupying the Udas Temple. You may be able to find it if you go deep inside the Udas Temple.

string.name: STR_DIC_E_IDTemple_FanaticFiNamed_53_Ah
string.body: Nexus;The head of the Dragonbound in the Udas Temple, whose power can convert even an ordinary person into a Dragonbound.

string.name: STR_DIC_E_IDTemple_SensoryArea_Q30011
string.body: Source of Poison;The source of the Dragonbound's deadly poison. Rumour has it that they raise poisonous insects somewhere in the Lower Udas Temple.

string.name: STR_DIC_E_IDTemple_FanaticAsNamed_53_Ah
string.body: Chura Twinblade;A boss of the Dragonbound. Chura Twinblade follows orders from Malika under the Udas Temple.

string.name: STR_DIC_E_Q30051
string.body: Equally Strong Asmodian;Any Asmodian Daeva whose level is similar to yours, within 9 levels lower and 5 levels higher.

string.name: STR_DIC_E_Q30151
string.body: Equally Strong Elyos;Any Elyos Daeva whose level is similar to yours, within 9 levels lower and 5 levels higher.

string.name: STR_DIC_E_IDTemple_PoisonBottle_Q30010
string.body: Poison Bottle;A bottle of the poison the Dragonbound use on their weapons. They are scattered throughout Udas Temple for easy access in case of attack.

string.name: STR_DIC_E_IDTemple_OctacideNamed_54_Ah
string.body: Kingspin;The venom squeezed from Kingspin's Poison Sac forms the base of the Dragonbound's poison.

string.name: STR_DIC_E_Q11456all
string.body: Mutant Insects;Refers to [%dic:STR_DIC_M_IDElim_1F_Sheluk_51_Ae]s, [%dic:STR_DIC_M_IDElim_1F_Octaside_51_Ae]s, [%dic:STR_DIC_M_IDElim_1F_Spakle_51_Ae]s, [%dic:STR_DIC_M_IDElim_1F_Clodworm_51_Ae]s, [%dic:STR_DIC_M_IDElim_1F_EXPSheluk_51_Ae]s, [%dic:STR_DIC_M_IDElim_1F_EXPOctaside_51_Ae]s, and [%dic:STR_DIC_M_IDElim_1F_EXPSpakle_51_Ae]s.

string.name: STR_DIC_E_Q11048_1F
string.body: Taloc's Roots Creatures;Refers to all creatures that harm the Holy Tree Taloc by intruding on the [%dic:STR_DIC_W_IDElim_1F].

string.name: STR_DIC_E_Q11048_2F
string.body: Insects of Taloc's Boughs;Creatures that have invaded [%dic:STR_DIC_W_IDElim_2F_Field] and cause him harm.

string.name: STR_DIC_E_Q11048_3F
string.body: Creatures of Taloc's Heart;Refers to all creatures that harm Taloc by intruding on the [%dic:STR_DIC_W_IDElim_3F].

string.name: STR_DIC_OBJ_IDElim_Mark_Q11457
string.body: Taloc's Knot;A measurement of the Holy Tree Taloc's growth.

string.name: STR_DIC_E_Q10020all
string.body: Hikiron Farm Balaur;Balaur who dwell in the Hikiron Farm, including [%dic:STR_DIC_M_LF4_A2_DrakanWorkerFi_51_An]s, [%dic:STR_DIC_M_LF4_A2_DrakanWorkerPr_51_An]s, [%dic:STR_DIC_M_LF4_A2_LizardAs_52_An]s, and [%dic:STR_DIC_M_LF4_A2_LizardFi_52_An]s.

string.name: STR_DIC_E_UnderPass_Li
string.body: Silentera Canyon;An underground corridor connecting Gelkmaros and Inggison. The entrances open from the [%dic:STR_DIC_W_LF4_SZ_2021_A] and the [%dic:STR_DIC_W_LF4_SZ_2011_A]. Deep inside the Canyon lies the [%dic:STR_DIC_W_ZONE_NAME_IDCatacombs].

string.name: STR_DIC_E_UnderPass_Da
string.body: Silentera Canyon;An underground corridor connecting Gelkmaros and Inggison. The entrances open from the [%dic:STR_DIC_W_DF4_SZ_3011_A] and the [%dic:STR_DIC_W_DF4_SZ_3021_A]. Deep inside the Canyon lies the [%dic:STR_DIC_W_ZONE_NAME_IDCatacombs].

string.name: STR_DIC_E_IDCatacombsN_DrakanMonkBossNmd_55_Ah
string.body: Isbariya the Resolute;A Balaur Protector who is sealing something inside the Beshmundir Temple.

string.name: STR_DIC_E_IDCatacombsN_UnDrakanScNmd_55_Ah
string.body: Manadar;The Stormwing leader in the Beshmundir Temple's [%dic:STR_DIC_W_IDCatacombs_SZ_B1].

string.name: STR_DIC_E_IDCatacombsN_DrakanFiDayNmd_55_Ah
string.body: Vehala the Cursed;The Tiamat leader in the Beshmundir Temple's [%dic:STR_DIC_W_IDCatacombs_SZ_B2]. His curse is to appear sometimes as a living creature and sometimes as one of the undead.

string.name: STR_DIC_E_IDCatacombsN_SpecterNmd_55_Ah
string.body: Ahbana the Wicked;Bound to the Beshmundir Temple's [%dic:STR_DIC_W_IDCatacombs_SZ_A3] by a curse, he appears if you destroy the Warrior Monuments.

string.name: STR_DIC_E_IDCatacombsN_HugeSlimeNmd_55_Ah
string.body: The Plaguebearer;An overgrown Slime living in the Beshmundir Temple's [%dic:STR_DIC_W_IDCatacombs_SZ_B2].

string.name: STR_DIC_E_IDCatacombsN_ShulackNmd_55_Ah
string.body: Dorakiki the Bold;The boss of the Nightshade Clan. He hides in the Beshmundir Temple's [%dic:STR_DIC_W_IDCatacombs_SZ_D4].

string.name: STR_DIC_E_IDCatacombsN_LichNmd_55_Ah
string.body: Macunbello;A malicious shaman hiding in the Beshmundir Temple's [%dic:STR_DIC_W_IDCatacombs_SZ_B4] beneath. He feeds on Daevas' pained souls.

string.name: STR_DIC_E_Q11043
string.body: Aether Collecting Plate;Plates of collected Aether. You can obtain them from the [%dic:STR_DIC_OBJ_LF4_FOBJ_Q11043A], the [%dic:STR_DIC_OBJ_LF4_FOBJ_Q11043B], the [%dic:STR_DIC_OBJ_LF4_FOBJ_Q11043C], and the [%dic:STR_DIC_OBJ_LF4_FOBJ_Q11043D].

string.name: STR_DIC_E_Q11215
string.body: Guardian General of the Temple of Scales;Refers to the Guardian General that once occupied the Temple of Scales.

string.name: STR_DIC_E_Q11216
string.body: Ancient Dragon's Insignia;An insignia depicting the Ancient Dragon's crest and carried by guards who defend the Temple of Scales.

string.name: STR_DIC_E_IDCatacombsN_ElementalFireNmd_55_Ah
string.body: Flarestorm;A Flame Spirit shackled by the Balaur and confined to the Beshmundir Temple's [%dic:STR_DIC_W_IDCatacombs_SZ_D2].

string.name: STR_DIC_E_IDCatacombsN_DeathNightNmd_55_Ah
string.body: Taros Lifebane;An ancient Daeva, fettered by the Balaur and now guarding the [%dic:STR_DIC_W_IDCatacombs_SZ_D].

string.name: STR_DIC_E_LF4_DragonTablet_Q30205
string.body: Dragon Lord Monument;The stony monuments of Dragon Lords seen throughout Inggison. They include the [%dic:STR_DIC_OBJ_LF4_DragonTabletA_Q30205], the [%dic:STR_DIC_OBJ_LF4_DragonTabletB_Q30205], the [%dic:STR_DIC_OBJ_LF4_DragonTabletC_Q30205], and the [%dic:STR_DIC_OBJ_LF4_DragonTabletD_Q30205].

string.name: STR_DIC_E_DF4_DragonTablet_Q30305
string.body: Dragon Lord Memorial Tower;The memorial towers of Dragon Lords seen throughout Gelkmaros. They include the [%dic:STR_DIC_OBJ_DF4_DragonTabletA_Q30305], the [%dic:STR_DIC_OBJ_DF4_DragonTabletB_Q30305], the [%dic:STR_DIC_OBJ_DF4_DragonTabletC_Q30305], and the [%dic:STR_DIC_OBJ_DF4_DragonTabletD_Q30305].

string.name: STR_DIC_M_DF4_Drakan_Runner
string.body: Traitor Kumbanda;The Balaur who allegedly stole Siel's Relics from the Crashed Dredgion. Both the Balaur and the Asmodians are hunting him.

string.name: STR_DIC_M_QUEST_20022
string.body: Defeated Nadukas;Balaur that survived the crash of the Dredgion. They include [%dic:STR_DIC_M_DF4_DrakanFi_51_An], [%dic:STR_DIC_M_DF4_LizardFi_51_An], [%dic:STR_DIC_M_DF4_LizardAs_51_An], and [%dic:STR_DIC_OBJ_DF4_FOBJ_Q20020].

string.name: STR_DIC_W_QUEST_20022
string.body: Marayas Drana Growing Device Destruction Site;Place where the [%dic:STR_DIC_OBJ_DF4_DranaSuctionDevice_B3_Q20022] can be destroyed.

string.name: STR_DIC_E_QUEST_20023
string.body: Brainwashed Reian;Reian tribesmen brainwashed at the Rebirthing Chamber in Subterranea.

string.name: STR_DIC_M_QUEST_20024
string.body: Balaur of Vorgaltem Battlefield;Balaur found at the Vorgaltem Battlefield. They include [%dic:STR_DIC_M_DF4_DrakanFi_Re_C_54_An]s, [%dic:STR_DIC_M_DF4_DrakanAs_Re_C_54_An]s, [%dic:STR_DIC_M_DF4_DrakanPr_Re_C_54_An]s, [%dic:STR_DIC_M_DF4_DrakanRa_Re_54_An]s, and [%dic:STR_DIC_M_DF4_DrakanWi_Re_C_54_An]s.

string.name: STR_DIC_M_QUEST_20025
string.body: Powerful Balaur;Mighty Balaur in the [%dic:STR_DIC_W_SZ_DF4_C6], including [%dic:STR_DIC_M_DF4_21241], [%dic:STR_DIC_M_DF4_DrakanFi_DR_55_Ah]s, [%dic:STR_DIC_M_DF4_DrakanAs_DR_55_Ah]s, [%dic:STR_DIC_M_DF4_DrakanRa_DR_55_Ah]s, [%dic:STR_DIC_M_DF4_DrakanWi_DR_55_Ah]es, and [%dic:STR_DIC_M_DF4_DrakanPr_DR_55_Ah]s.

string.name: STR_DIC_M_QUEST_11200all
string.body: Altar of Avarice Garrison;Enemy soldiers who appear to keep you from recapturing the [%dic:STR_DIC_W_LF4_SZ_2021_A].

string.name: STR_DIC_E_QUEST_19000
string.body: Three Jewels;Only Experts can obtain these--the [%dic:STR_DIC_I_JEWELRY_QUEST_55A], the [%dic:STR_DIC_I_JEWELRY_QUEST_55B], and the [%dic:STR_DIC_I_JEWELRY_QUEST_55C].

string.name: STR_DIC_E_QUEST_19002

string.body: Eremitia's Noble Greatsword;Your Weaponsmithing mastery project. You will need to get the design and prototype of Eremitia's Greatsword or of Eremitia's Noble Greatsword from [%dic:STR_DIC_N_Nakia].

string.name: STR_DIC_E_QUEST_19038

string.body: Agehia's Noble Greatsword;Your Weaponsmithing mastery project. To make it, you will need to the greatsword prototype and the design of Agehia's Greatsword or Agehia's Noble Greatsword from [%dic:STR_DIC_N_Mime].

string.name: STR_DIC_E_QUEST_29014

string.name: STR_DIC_E_Q35032
string.body: Food Aid;Food for delivery to those suffering from hunger. Refers specifically to [%dic:STR_DIC_G_QUEST_35032_01], [%dic:STR_DIC_G_QUEST_35032_02], and [%dic:STR_DIC_G_QUEST_35032_03].

string.name: STR_DIC_E_Q2094
string.body: Adma Stronghold;A cursed stronghold in Brusthonin. You can enter it via the [%dic:STR_DIC_OBJ_DF2a_AdmaDoor_In] or the [%dic:STR_DIC_OBJ_DF2a_WaterWayDoor_Q2094] so long as you have the Ribbit Essence Sahnu gave you.

They are [%dic:STR_DIC_M_IDDreadgion_02_DrakanMaNamed_55_Ae], [%dic:STR_DIC_M_IDDreadgion_02_DrakanPrNCB_55_Ae], [%dic:STR_DIC_M_IDDreadgion_02_DrakanMaSBoss_55_Ah], [%dic:STR_DIC_M_IDDreadgion_02_DrakanFiDRB_55_Ae], [%dic:STR_DIC_M_IDDreadgion_02_DrakanFiMAB_55_Ae], and [%dic:STR_DIC_M_IDDreadgion_02_DrakanRaKeyNamedB_55_Ae].

string.name: STR_DIC_OBJ_IDDreadgion_02_Drakanbox_Q3721
string.body: Balaur Weapons;Weapons used by the Balaur. They are stored in the armoury on the Chantra Dredgion.

string.name: STR_DIC_OBJ_IDDreadgion_02_Drakanbox_Q3723
string.body: Balaur Supplies;A box of supplies transported by the Chantra Dredgion and distributed regularly to Balaur legions on the front line. Obtained from supplies storage or Shulack labourers.

string.name: STR_DIC_E_Q28504
string.body: Haramel's Inhabitants;Enemies who are in Haramel, Hamerun's sinister factory.

string.name: STR_DIC_E_Q28505
string.body: Hamerun's Faithful Minions;Hamerun's key subordinates [%dic:STR_DIC_M_IDNovice_02_DBrownieWWa_named_18_an], [%dic:STR_DIC_M_IDNovice_05_RatmanMWa_named_19_an], and [%dic:STR_DIC_M_IDNovice_07_DBrownieWWa_named_20_an].

string.name: STR_DIC_E_OBJ_IDElim_Seed_Q11450
string.body: Taloc's Soil;Soil blighted by the excessive amount of Aether inside Taloc. Taloc feels pain from this soil, like wounds.

string.name: STR_DIC_M_QUEST_2020all
string.body: Black Claw Mau;Mau of the Black Claw tribe, such as [%dic:STR_DIC_M_LycanWarriorS_16_Ae]s and [%dic:STR_DIC_M_IDNovice_07_LycanWa_prion_18_an]s.

string.name: STR_DIC_M_IDLF1_Drakan_Creature

string.name: STR_DIC_M_IDCatacombs_Shulack
string.body: Nightshade Clan;A band of Shulacks who snuck into the Garden of the Entombed to rob Drakan tombs in Beshmundir Temple. Includes [%dic:STR_DIC_M_IDCatacombsN_ShulackFi_55_Ae]s, [%dic:STR_DIC_M_IDCatacombsN_ShulackWi_55_Ae]s, [%dic:STR_DIC_M_IDCatacombsN_ShulackAs_55_Ae]s, [%dic:STR_DIC_M_IDCatacombsN_ShulackSc_55_Ae]s, and [%dic:STR_DIC_M_IDCatacombsN_ShulackPr_55_Ae]s.

string.name: STR_DIC_E_QUEST_18501all
string.body: Odium;Specifically refers to Odium in Haramel. It can be obtained by examining [%dic:STR_DIC_OBJ_ODBox] and [%dic:STR_DIC_OBJ_IDNovice_Rough_Odum].

string.name: STR_DIC_W_IDNovice_SZ_IDNovice
string.body: Haramel;A suspicious factory run by Hamerun that produces Odium and Odella. It can be entered via the [%dic:STR_DIC_OBJ_Instance_Entrance] in the Cantas Coast.

string.name: STR_DIC_W_IDNovice_SZ_IDNovice_Da
string.body: Haramel;A suspicious factory run by Hamerun that produces Odium and Odella. It can be entered via the [%dic:STR_DIC_OBJ_Instance_Entrance_Da] in Impetusium.

string.body: Bed Materials;The feathers of a [%dic:STR_DIC_M_LF4_B3_Condor_Dr_53_An] and stems of a [%dic:STR_DIC_M_LF4_B3_Agrint_Green_53_An]. They make a soft and comfy bed.

string.name: STR_DIC_E_Q11229
string.body: Wind Mushrooms;Mushrooms that grow by feeding on wind energy, including the [%dic:STR_DIC_OBJ_Toadstool], [%dic:STR_DIC_OBJ_Toadstool_002], and [%dic:STR_DIC_OBJ_Toadstool_003].

string.name: STR_DIC_M_21079
string.body: Mitrakand Beacon Soldiers;Drakan, Mau, and Krall soldiers who guard the [%dic:STR_DIC_W_DF4_SZ_C1_Fire].

string.name: STR_DIC_E_Daily_1
string.body: Asmodians;Asmodian Daevas. Be warned that defeating Asmodians more than 10 character levels below yours does nothing to improve the reputation of Radiant Ops.

string.name: STR_DIC_E_Daily_2
string.body: Elyos;Elyos Daevas. The Blood Crusade finds that defeating Elyos more than 10 character levels below yours does not demonstrate strength--only cowardice.

string.name: STR_DIC_W_Daily
string.body: All Regions;Anywhere in Atreia where an encounter with an enemy is possible, including Balaurea and the Abyss.

string.name: STR_DIC_E_Teleport_Lc
string.body: Approval of the Seraphim Lords;An order from Lavirintos which is undertaken at level 50. You must complete the Bound for Inggison! quest for this privilege.

string.name: STR_DIC_E_Teleport_Dc
string.body: Approval of the Shedim Lords;An order from Vidar which is undertaken at level 50. You must complete the Traveling to Gelkmaros quest for this privilege.

They include Veteran Tursin Watchers, Veteran Tursin Loudmouths, Veteran Tursin Loudmouth Bosses, Veteran Tursin Shamans, Tursin Bigmouths, Veteran Tursin Crackers, Tursin Veteran Commanders, Veteran Tursin Scouts, Veteran Tursin Healers, and Veteran Tursin Gateblockers.

string.body: Garrison Elites;Tursin Krall Elite Soldiers guarding the [%dic:STR_DIC_FLA23]. Refers to Crack Tursin Bigmouths, Tursin Bigmouth Bosses, Tursin Gutspiller Bosses, Crack Tursin Trackers, and Veteran Tursin Loudmouth Bosses.

string.body: Underground Creature;In the [%dic:STR_DIC_W_LF2_SZ_C3], you'll find Old Eracus Gargoyles, Shielded Skyrays, Wild Sandstorm Spirits, Blackclaw Fangwings, Flirtatious Temptresses, Relentless Bloodwings, and Eracus Mugolems.

These include: Veteran Kaidan Chargers, Veteran Kaidan Wallarms, Veteran Kaidan Grapplers, Veteran Kaidan Slicers, Veteran Kaidan Snappers, Veteran Kaidan Spearthrowers, Veteran Kaidan Necromancers and Veteran Kaidan Mages.

These can be [%dic:STR_DIC_M_LehparAs_39_An]s, [%dic:STR_DIC_M_LehparKn_38_An]s, [%dic:STR_DIC_M_LehparKn_40_An]s, [%dic:STR_DIC_M_LehparPreist_39_An]s, [%dic:STR_DIC_M_LehparWa_38_An]s, [%dic:STR_DIC_M_LehparWa_40_An]s, or [%dic:STR_DIC_M_LehparWizard_39_An]s.

They include Veteran Tursin Watchers, Veteran Tursin Loudmouths, Veteran Tursin Loudmouth Bosses, Veteran Tursin Shamans, Veteran Tursin Wallarms, Tursin Veteran Commanders, Veteran Tursin Scouts, Veteran Tursin Healers, and Veteran Tursin Gateblockers.

string.body: Tursin Elites;Veteran Krall guarding the [%dic:STR_DIC_FLA23]. They include Crack Tursin Bigmouths, Crack Tursin Smackstoppers, Tursin Gutspiller Bosss, Crack Tursin Trackers, and Crack Krall Tower Wallarms.

string.name: STR_DIC_M_37104
string.body: Fiends of Eracus;Refers to creatures on the [%dic:STR_DIC_W_LF2_SZ_C3] floor. They include Old Eracus Gargoyles, Shielded Skyrays, Wild Sandstorm Spirits, Blackclaw Fangwings, Flirtatious Temptresses, Relentless Bloodwings, and Eracus Mugolems.

string.body: Veteran[pl:"Veterans"] of the Kaidan Krall;Krall soldiers found in the [%dic:STR_DIC_W_LF2_SZ_H]. These include: Veteran Kaidan Chargers, Veteran Kaidan Wallarms, Veteran Kaidan Grapplers, Veteran Kaidan Slicers, Veteran Kaidan Snappers, Veteran Kaidan Mages and Veteran Kaidan Necromancers.

string.body: Bastion Lephies;Refers to Lepharists in the [%dic:STR_DIC_W_LF2_SZ_J], including Assassins, Lepharist Defenders, Lepharist Defence Commanders, Lepharist Healers, Lepharist Assaulters, Lepharist Footsoldiers, and Sorcerers.

string.name: STR_DIC_M_37116
string.body: Fanatic Krall;[%dic:STR_DIC_W_LF3_SZ_E1] Krall gone insane from taking too much Aether. They include Insane Guards, Insane Crackers, Insane Scouts, Insane Slicers, Insane Loudmouths, Insane Loudmouth Bosses, Insane Dark Shamans, and Insane Cursers.

string.name: STR_DIC_M_37119

These include Ebon Sorcerer Liches, Equitatus Zealots, Unfest Berserkers, Cursed Priest Shades, Cursed Mage Shades, Cursed Warrior Shades, Cursed Fighter Shades, Tattered Bloodwings, Unfest Berserkers, Dark Mage Liches, Starved Vampires, and Guardian Vampires.

string.name: STR_DIC_E_IDArena_Solo_Bonus_In
string.body: Crucible Rift;A dimension gate often seen during Stage 6 of the Crucible Challenge. This phenomenon is said to appear when Vanktrist's powers breach the Aetheric field around Illusion Stadium.

string.name: STR_DIC_M_quest_18208a
string.body: Crucible Infiltrator;Enemies that appear through a [%dic:STR_DIC_E_IDArena_Solo_Bonus_In], which opens in Stage 6 of the Crucible Challenge. Depending on which rumour you listen too, they're either Balaur or Asmodians.

string.name: STR_DIC_M_quest_28208a
string.body: Crucible Infiltrator;Enemies that appear through the [%dic:STR_DIC_E_IDArena_Solo_Bonus_In], which opens in Stage 6 of the Crucible Challenge. The rumour is that they're either Balaur or Elyos.

string.name: STR_DIC_E_Quest_37500a
string.body: Elyos Crafting Associate;[%dic:STR_DIC_N_Rmenia] and [%dic:STR_DIC_N_Michele] accept craft items.

string.name: STR_DIC_E_Quest_47500a
string.body: Crafting Apprentice;[%dic:STR_DIC_N_Heather] and [%dic:STR_DIC_N_Aizenne], whose job it is to accept items crafted by members.

string.name: STR_DIC_E_IDArena_Solo_S6_VanqJr_55_An
string.body: Vanktrist Spacetwine;A mysterious creature encountered during the final stage of the Crucible Challenge. Its ability to distort space is a threat to the Aetheric field.

string.name: STR_DIC_E_fish_n_c_10c
string.body: Afari;Omnivorous fish that multiply rapidly. They can be found in the waters of the [%dic:STR_DIC_W_LF2_SZ_OP] and the [%dic:STR_DIC_W_LF2_SZ_A2].

string.name: STR_DIC_E_fish_n_c_20a
string.body: Lapia;Fish commonly caught and cooked. They can be found in the river near the [%dic:STR_DIC_W_LF2_SZ_OP].

string.name: STR_DIC_E_herb_n_c_20a
string.body: Lumesia;An herb that is used in making Life Serum. It grows in abundance around the [%dic:STR_DIC_W_LF2_SZ_A1].

string.name: STR_DIC_E_vegetable_n_c_20a
string.body: Rubashi;A fibrous stalky vegetable. It is commonly found around the [%dic:STR_DIC_W_LF2_SZ_A1_SUB_2] and [%dic:STR_DIC_W_LF2_SZ_A1_SUB_1].

string.name: STR_DIC_E_metal_n_c_20a
string.body: Titanium Ore;A gleaming black ore. It can be found throughout Eltnen, in places like the [%dic:STR_DIC_W_LF2_SZ_A1], the [%dic:STR_DIC_W_LF2_SZ_B], and the Eracus Desert.

string.name: STR_DIC_E_plant_n_c_20a
string.body: Fess;An annual plant. It is commonly sought after because its fibers are used for Thread. They grow mainly in desert regions such as [%dic:STR_DIC_W_LF2_SZ_G3_SUB_1], the Eracus Desert, and the [%dic:STR_DIC_W_LF2_SZ_G1].

string.name: STR_DIC_E_noblemetal_n_c_20a
string.body: Gold Ore;A gleaming yellow ore. Gold can be found in the Eracus Desert, the [%dic:STR_DIC_W_LF2_SZ_C1_SUB_1], the [%dic:STR_DIC_W_LF2_SZ_G1], and other areas.

string.name: STR_DIC_E_noblemetal_n_r_20a
string.body: Greater Gold Ore;A Gold Ore that has few impurities. Gold ore can be found in the Eracus Desert, the [%dic:STR_DIC_W_LF2_SZ_C1_SUB_1], the [%dic:STR_DIC_W_LF2_SZ_G1] and other areas.

string.name: STR_DIC_E_tree_n_c_20a
string.body: Koa Tree;Trees that grow in warm, damp areas. Many grow near the [%dic:STR_DIC_W_LF2_SZ_A1], as well as the [%dic:STR_DIC_W_LF2_SZ_B] and [%dic:STR_DIC_W_LF2_SZ_G1].

string.name: STR_DIC_E_herb_n_c_20b
string.body: Umblia;An herb used in making Mana Potions. It normally grows in desert regions such as the [%dic:STR_DIC_W_LF2_SZ_B], the [%dic:STR_DIC_W_LF2_SZ_C1_SUB_1], and the Eracus Desert.

string.name: STR_DIC_E_vegetable_n_c_20b
string.body: Ruta;A vegetable used in cooking. It grows in the Eracus Desert and near the [%dic:STR_DIC_W_LF2_SZ_F2].

string.name: STR_DIC_E_plant_n_c_20b
string.body: Fess Fiber;A plant that is used as cloth material. It is commonly found in the [%dic:STR_DIC_W_LF2_SZ_A1_SUB_2], [%dic:STR_DIC_W_LF2_SZ_G1], and the [%dic:STR_DIC_W_LF2_SZ_F2].

string.name: STR_DIC_E_noblemetal_n_c_30a
string.body: Platinum Ore;A very hard ore that gleams white. It is found on the [%dic:STR_DIC_W_LF2_SZ_I1] and near the Eltnen Observatory.

string.name: STR_DIC_E_metal_n_c_30b
string.body: Adamantium Ore;A very hard ore found in abundance at the turning of the path to the [%dic:STR_DIC_W_LF2_SZ_I1].

string.body: Ophelos's Bag;A bag that contains [%dic:STR_DIC_E_noblemetal_n_c_30a] and other sundry goods.

string.name: STR_DIC_E_fish_n_c_20b

string.name: STR_DIC_E_fish_n_c_30a
string.body: Pleuro;A tasteless but inoffensive fish. They inhabit the river in front of [%dic:STR_DIC_W_LF2_SZ_G3_SUB_1].

string.name: STR_DIC_E_metal_n_c_20b

string.name: STR_DIC_E_metal_n_c_30a
string.body: Adamantium Ore;An ore which is used to make weapons and armour. It is buried throughout the whole region of Eltnen.

string.name: STR_DIC_E_doc_quest_1451a
string.body: Ophelos's Bag;A bag sent by [%dic:STR_DIC_N_Ophelos] to [%dic:STR_DIC_N_Hagne]. It feels quite heavy.

string.name: STR_DIC_E_tree_n_c_20b
string.body: Ulmus Log;A log from a tree famed for its density. It can be found near the [%dic:STR_DIC_W_LF2_SZ_I2] and [%dic:STR_DIC_W_LF2_SZ_G3]. Due to its dense structure and resistance to twisting, it is often used for woodcrafting.

string.name: STR_DIC_E_jewelry_n_c_20c
string.body: Zircon Ore;Ore that can be found in the Eltnen region. It can usually be found in the crevices of rocks or stone walls.

string.name: STR_DIC_E_herb_n_c_30a
string.body: Nepeta;An herb used in making potions. It is also called 'Shugo Grass', and Shugos seem to love it. It only grows in [%dic:STR_DIC_W_LF2_SZ_I1].

string.name: STR_DIC_E_jewelry_n_c_20d

string.body: Zircon Ore;Ore found in the Eltnen region. It is difficult to find.

string.name: STR_DIC_E_jewelry_n_c_20a
string.body: Topaz Ore;A red, semi-precious ore that is popular among Daevas. It is found in the [%dic:STR_DIC_W_LF2_SZ_B], the [%dic:STR_DIC_W_LF2_SZ_A1_SUB_2], the [%dic:STR_DIC_W_LF2_SZ_A2] and elsewhere.

string.name: STR_DIC_E_gb_source_jewelry_30a
string.body: Garnet;An gem found in [%dic:STR_DIC_E_jewelry_n_c_20d]. It can be found in the Eracus Desert and [%dic:STR_DIC_W_LF2_SZ_E1_SUB_1].

string.body: Aquamarine;A gem found in [%dic:STR_DIC_E_jewelry_n_c_20b]. It is found at the [%dic:STR_DIC_W_LF2_SZ_G1] and [%dic:STR_DIC_W_LF2_SZ_E1].

string.name: STR_DIC_E_gb_source_jewelry_30b
string.body: Lazuli Ore;A vein of ore in which yields Lazuli rocks. It can be found near the [%dic:STR_DIC_W_LF2_SZ_E2_SUB_1], in [%dic:STR_DIC_W_LF2_SZ_G4], and near the [%dic:STR_DIC_W_LF2_SZ_I2] of Eltnen or in the [%dic:STR_DIC_W_LF3_SZ_D2] and the [%dic:STR_DIC_W_LF3_SZ_D4] of Heiron.

string.name: STR_DIC_E_jewelry_n_c_30b
string.body: Lazuli;A rock found in [%dic:STR_DIC_E_gb_source_jewelry_30b]. It can be found at the [%dic:STR_DIC_W_LF2_SZ_E2_SUB_1], the [%dic:STR_DIC_W_LF2_SZ_G4], and the [%dic:STR_DIC_W_LF2_SZ_I2]. In Heiron, it is found in [%dic:STR_DIC_W_LF3_SZ_D2] and [%dic:STR_DIC_W_LF3_SZ_D4].

string.body: Ruko Fiber;Fiber collected from a [%dic:STR_DIC_E_gb_source_plant_10b] plants found on the [%dic:STR_DIC_FLA19].

string.name: STR_DIC_E_gb_source_noblemetal_d_30a

string.name: STR_DIC_E_sadenaloves

string.body: Iron Ore;Ore which is used to make weapons and magical materials. Its deposits are found in all over the Tolbas Forest and the [%dic:STR_DIC_FLA23].

string.name: STR_DIC_I_start_spring
string.body: The Genesis Spring;A Spring in [%dic:STR_DIC_W_LF3_SZ_DTW]. It stretches from the roots of the mysterious tree Arbolu to the entrance of the village. The mixture of the spring water and Arbolu's sap has the power to purify the unclean.

string.body: Aether Crystal;A crystal of Aether floating above the [%dic:STR_DIC_W_LF2_SZ_C3]. It can be extracted from [%dic:STR_DIC_LF3_ae_source_od_20a].

string.name: STR_DIC_LF3_ae_source_od_20a

Linon is known to grow in the [%dic:STR_DIC_W_LF3_SZ_D7], in [%dic:STR_DIC_W_LF3_SZ_D9], [%dic:STR_DIC_W_LF3_SZ_D8], in the [%dic:STR_DIC_W_LF3_SZ_F1], [%dic:STR_DIC_W_LF3_SZ_F2], and [%dic:STR_DIC_W_LF3_SZ_015].

string.body: Linon;A plant from which you can extract fiber. It grows in the [%dic:STR_DIC_W_LF3_SZ_D7], in [%dic:STR_DIC_W_LF3_SZ_D9] and [%dic:STR_DIC_W_LF3_SZ_D8], and in the [%dic:STR_DIC_W_LF3_SZ_F1], [%dic:STR_DIC_W_LF3_SZ_F2], and [%dic:STR_DIC_W_LF3_SZ_015].

string.body: Titanium;A metal found in Theobomos.

string.name: STR_DIC_LF2a_gb_source_noblemetal_20a_lf2a
string.body: Gold;A quality metal found in Theobomos. It commands a high price because of its rarity.

string.body: Zircon Ore;An ore found in certain regions of Theobomos.

string.name: STR_DIC_LF2a_GB_SOURCE_TREE_40A_LF2B_B
string.body: Egrasi;Most commonly gathered in the Dirmoi Pass, the Empyrean Lords Sanctuary, and The Stalking Grounds in Theobomos. Egrasi trees are often found growing near larger trees, where they leeches nutrients from their roots.

string.name: STR_DIC_LF2a_GB_SOURCE_jr_part_dia_02a

string.name: STR_DIC_LF2a_GB_SOURCE_od_n_r_40a
string.body: Greater Aether;A rare substance that can be used imbue an item.

string.name: STR_DIC_E_air_collection_treasure01
string.body: Old Weathered Seal;A seal crafted by the Jotun. It can be obtained from animals, plants, or chests found in regions only accessible via windstream or geyser.

string.name: STR_DIC_W_IDCromede
string.body: Kromede's Trial;A dream world shown by Stigma infused with the thoughts of Kromede and Robstin. Elyos can enter it with the help of Daeva of Dream Reading [%dic:STR_DIC_N_Raninia], and Asmodians with the help of Daeva of Psychic Arts [%dic:STR_DIC_N_Bridget].

string.name: STR_DIC_M_18605
string.body: Dungeon Prisoners;Lost souls locked up in [%dic:STR_DIC_W_IDCromede_Prison].
